Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery oinochoe with turn of neck; exterior: neck black; panel decorated with scales representing breast feathers (added purple on dots in every third row) with broad painted band on each side.
Curator's comments: Sherd joins British Museum 1886,0401.1125 and 1924,1201.1157 (unnumbered) and belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.35 and 1924,1201.36. Assembled together: shoulder and body sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery oinochoe with turn of neck; exterior: black neck; on shoulder, central panel decorated with scales representing breast feathers (purple on dots in every third row) with broad painted band on each side; oblique bars representing wing feathers, filled with dots. Assembled dimensions: h.: 7.5 cm; w.: 15 cm. The decoration seems to have been inspired by the conventional representation of a bird (partridge): scales for the breast feathers, bars for the folded wings (Cook). The breast-feather panel narrowing towards the bottom and the red on these feathers are unusual; the black bands are unusually wide. For a complete oinochoe with this decoration, see Walter-Karydi 1973, pl. 4, no. 47 (from Rhodes). See also Cook 1998, 82, fig. 10.4 (Louvre A321).
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (8, no. 1)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 247, no. 3a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.149)
